intro: Centaurium pulchellum var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
